node.Description: Python offers a range of libraries for encrypting and securing network communication. In this article, we will explore two of the most popular — cryptography and Paramiko.

DoD + DevSecOps: A path toward speed and agility
Use library injection to auto-instrument tracing for Kubernetes applications with Datadog APM
node.Description: Many organizations rely on distributed tracing in Datadog APM to gain end-to-end visibility into the performance of their Kubernetes applications. But as teams grow, it can become impractical for them to manually configure each new application with the libraries and environment variables needed for tracing. Traditionally, this manual configuration has required developers to build a new application image with the appropriate tracing library installed—a process that activates a CI/CD pipeline and brings development to a temporary halt.

node.Title: The Benefits of Setting Goals and Tips For Sticking to Them
node.Description:
Does it ever feel like you’re spinning your wheels but not getting anywhere? Do you want to make more progress in your life and career but aren’t sure how to get there? Setting goals can be the answer. Having clear objectives helps provide direction, focus, and motivation, so you can make better decisions and achieve your goals faster. So, let’s jump right into the benefits of goal-setting and our top

node.Title: Inside Geo Key Manager v2: re-imagining access control for distributed systems
node.Description: Using the story of Geo Key Manager v2 as an example, let’s re-imagine access control for distributed systems using a variant of public-key cryptography, called attribute-based encryption.

node.Title: Cyberattacks on Holocaust educational websites increased in 2022
node.Description:
Today, 78 years after the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp, we mark the International Holocaust Remembrance Day.
With Cloudflare’s Project Galileo, we protect Holocaust educational websites and at risk public interest groups. Read more to see how attacks on these groups increased in 2022.

node.Title: Monitor Boundary on the HashiCorp Cloud Platform with Datadog
node.Description: HashiCorp Boundary provides a secure way to manage remote access to applications and infrastructure without exposing the underlying network or credentials. Launched two years ago as an open source solution, HashiCorp recently announced a fully managed version on the HashiCorp Cloud Platform (HCP), enabling you to manage identity-based authorizations, user and target onboarding, and more for dynamic environments. With the ability to create access controls based on the Zero Trust model, you can enforce verification for every user and device connected to your network.

Elastic Stack 8.6.1 released
node.Description:
Version 8.6.1 of the Elastic Stack was released today. We recommend you upgrade to this latest version over the 8.6.0 minor release.

The 8.6.1 release addresses a recent Elastic Cloud issue where a rolling restart would fail for some users.

For details of the issues that have been fixed and a full list of changes for each product in this version, please refer to the release notes.

node.Title: Improving the customer’s experience via ML-driven payment routing
node.Description: Co-Authors: Xianyun Mao, Stan Xu, Rachit Kumar, Vikas R, Xia Hong, and Divyakumar Menghani As a LinkedIn member, you can subscribe to LinkedIn Premium on a monthly or annual basis. For our customers, we offer the same option for our Talent Solutions and/or Sales Navigator products. For each, LinkedIn offers subscription renewal payments. These subscription renewal payments used to go through a rule-based routing engine to selected payment gateways, which often resulted in a less-than-optimal experience. In this blog, we will discuss how we replaced the existing rule-based approach […]
